Come get your game ready for the upcoming season by attending the Summit Academy High School Fall Basketball Camp! This camp is for all players, boys and girls, grades 4-8. The camp will be held Friday, November 8 and Saturday, November 9 from 7:00-8:30 PM in the Summit Academy High School gym. Our focus will be on offensive skill work, particularly ball handling and shooting, in preparation for your school, Super League, Jr. Jazz, AAU, and Church Ball seasons! All levels are welcome.

Cost is $25, payable to Summit Academy High School. You may pay in advance or at the door. Contact Coach Jeff Baird at summitacademybasketball@gmail.com with questions. Every player who attends the camp will receive free admission to our first varsity home game on Tuesday, November 26 at 7 PM against Rockwell, and will be automatically qualified to participate in a halftime game of Knockout. The winner of the halftime contest will win a Summit Academy High School Basketball shirt and a pair of shorts.

We are excited to announce several changes in our organization at Summit Academy for the 2018-2019 school year. Mr. Tyler Whittle, current principal of our Draper campus and K-8 executive director, will now become K-12 executive director and will no longer serve as principal of the Draper campus.

As K-12 director, Mr. Whittle will be able to help unify the vision for all of our Summit Academy campuses, including Summit Academy High School. This will allow Ms. Natalie Call, who currently serves as both principal of Summit Academy High School and 9-12 executive director, to focus exclusively on working with our students and educators as high school principal.

For more information, visit https://www.summitacademyschools.org/apps/pages/staff-changes

Sterling Scholar Deadlines coming up!

Friday, Dec. 8, 2017 – Deadline to let School Counselor, Mrs. Smith, know you are interested in applying for at least one category within Sterling Scholar.

Friday, Jan. 5, 2018 – Deadline for electronic submission of “Parent/Student Declaration” forms to be submitted electronically.

A Sterling Scholar is a high school senior or student graduating in the class of 2018 who is publicly recognized and awarded for the pursuit of excellence in scholarship, leadership and citizenship in the State of Utah. A potential Sterling Scholar presents an all-encompassing portfolio on their work in one of 15 specific categories and is interviewed by judges in the category’s field at various times.

Categories include: English, Math, Social Science, World Languages, Computer Technology, Skilled and Technical Science, Family & Consumer Sciences, Business & Marketing, Speech/Theater Arts/Forensics, Vocal Performance, Visual Arts, Instrumental Music, and, Dance.

Details visit www.sterlingscholar.org
